title: Cheese
data:
| % [![Cheese.png](/images/a/a5/Cheese.png)](/wiki/File:Cheese.png) |                                             |
| ----------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------- |
| Name                                                              | cheese                                      |
| Base price                                                        | 17 [zm](/wiki/Zorkmid "Zorkmid")            |
| Nutrition                                                         | [250](/wiki/Nutrition "Nutrition")          |
| Turns to eat                                                      | 2                                           |
| Weight                                                            | [2](/wiki/Weight "Weight")                  |
| Conduct                                                           | [vegetarian](/wiki/Conduct#Vegan "Conduct") |

**Cheese** is a type of [fleshy](/wiki/Fleshy "Fleshy") [comestible](/wiki/Comestible "Comestible") that appears in [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), [SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack"), [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM"), and [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)
- [2 Description](#Description)
- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)
- [4 Origin](#Origin)
- [5 References](#References)

## Generation

In addition to random generation, cheese can be found in delicatessen [shops](/wiki/Shop "Shop").

## Description

[Eating](/wiki/Eat "Eat") cheese confers 250 [nutrition](/wiki/Nutrition "Nutrition"). Despite being fleshy, cheese is [vegetarian](/wiki/Vegetarian "Vegetarian").[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

Cheese can be used to tame the various [rats](/wiki/Rat "Rat") encountered in the dungeon by throwing it at them, which may be the reason it is considered fleshy.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

## Strategy

At a weight of 2 [aum](/wiki/Aum "Aum"), cheese has a [nutrition/weight](/wiki/Nutrition/weight "Nutrition/weight") ratio second only to the [lembas wafer](/wiki/Lembas_wafer "Lembas wafer"), and non-vegan characters may consider it worth hanging on to. Cheese may also have some corner uses in taming rats, e.g. to avoid a potential death as a [pacifist](/wiki/Pacifist "Pacifist").

## Origin

[![Wikipedia](/images/thumb/f/f8/Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png/50px-Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png)](/wiki/File:Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png "Wikipedia")

[Wikipedia](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page "wikipedia:Main Page") has an article about:

***[Cheese](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Special:Search/Cheese "wikipedia:Special:Search/Cheese")***

Cheese is a dairy product produced in a range of flavors, textures, and forms by acidifying milk and adding particular enzymes in order to separate the milk into solid curds and liquid whey, before pressing them into finished cheese. Some cheeses have aromatic molds on the rind, the outer layer, or throughout the product. Over a thousand types exist, with their styles, textures and flavors depending on the origin of the milk (including the animal's diet), whether they have been pasteurised, the butterfat content, the bacteria and mold, the processing, and how long they have been aged.

Cheese in the pre-modern age was generally made using [rennet](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rennet "wikipedia:Rennet"), a set of enzymes produced in the stomachs of calves and other ruminant mammals - the rennet is what separates milk into solid curds and liquid whey. In modern times, most cheese is now made using chymosin from bacterial sources, with less than 5% of cheese in the US made using rennet - this may be the basis for the vegetarian status of cheese in SLASH'EM and other variants.

Cheese is valued for its portability, long shelf life, and high content of fat, protein, calcium, and phosphorus - while it has a longer shelf life than milk, how long a cheese will keep depends on the type: Hard cheeses, such as Parmesan, last longer than soft cheeses, such as Brie or goat's milk cheese. Vacuum packaging of block-shaped cheeses and gas-flushing of plastic bags with mixtures of carbon dioxide and nitrogen are used for storage and mass distribution of cheeses in the 21st century.

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [eat.c in SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2, line 2530](/wiki/Source:SLASH%27EM_0.0.7E7F2/eat.c#line2530 "Source:SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/eat.c")
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [mondata.h in SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2, line 240](/wiki/Source:SLASH%27EM_0.0.7E7F2/mondata.h#line240 "Source:SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/mondata.h")

[![This article may require revision for the next version of SLASH'EM. Click here for more information.](/images/3/38/Se7e7-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article may require revision for the next version of SLASH'EM. Click here for more information.")

[![This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/5/5d/Nh343var-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.")
html:
Cheese

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
%
Name cheese
Base price 17 zm
Nutrition 250
Turns to eat 2
Weight 2
Conduct vegetarian

Cheese is a type of fleshy comestible that appears in SLASH'EM, SpliceHack, SlashTHEM, and Hack'EM.

Contents

  • 1 Generation
  • 2 Description
  • 3 Strategy
  • 4 Origin
  • 5 References

Generation

In addition to random generation, cheese can be found in delicatessen shops.

Description

Eating cheese confers 250 nutrition. Despite being fleshy, cheese is vegetarian.[1]

Cheese can be used to tame the various rats encountered in the dungeon by throwing it at them, which may be the reason it is considered fleshy.[2]

Strategy

At a weight of 2 aum, cheese has a nutrition/weight ratio second only to the lembas wafer, and non-vegan characters may consider it worth hanging on to. Cheese may also have some corner uses in taming rats, e.g. to avoid a potential death as a pacifist.

Origin

Wikipedia has an article about:
Cheese

Cheese is a dairy product produced in a range of flavors, textures, and forms by acidifying milk and adding particular enzymes in order to separate the milk into solid curds and liquid whey, before pressing them into finished cheese. Some cheeses have aromatic molds on the rind, the outer layer, or throughout the product. Over a thousand types exist, with their styles, textures and flavors depending on the origin of the milk (including the animal's diet), whether they have been pasteurised, the butterfat content, the bacteria and mold, the processing, and how long they have been aged.

Cheese in the pre-modern age was generally made using rennet, a set of enzymes produced in the stomachs of calves and other ruminant mammals - the rennet is what separates milk into solid curds and liquid whey. In modern times, most cheese is now made using chymosin from bacterial sources, with less than 5% of cheese in the US made using rennet - this may be the basis for the vegetarian status of cheese in SLASH'EM and other variants.

Cheese is valued for its portability, long shelf life, and high content of fat, protein, calcium, and phosphorus - while it has a longer shelf life than milk, how long a cheese will keep depends on the type: Hard cheeses, such as Parmesan, last longer than soft cheeses, such as Brie or goat's milk cheese. Vacuum packaging of block-shaped cheeses and gas-flushing of plastic bags with mixtures of carbon dioxide and nitrogen are used for storage and mass distribution of cheeses in the 21st century.

References

  1. ↑ eat.c in SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2, line 2530
  2. ↑ mondata.h in SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2, line 240

'''Cheese''' is a type of [[fleshy]] [[comestible]] that appears in [[SLASH'EM]], [[SpliceHack]], [[SlashTHEM]], and [[Hack'EM]].

==Generation==
In addition to random generation, cheese can be found in delicatessen [[shop]]s.

==Description==
[[Eat]]ing cheese confers 250 [[nutrition]]. Despite being fleshy, cheese is [[vegetarian]].{{refsrc|eat.c|2530|version=SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2}}

Cheese can be used to tame the various [[rat]]s encountered in the dungeon by throwing it at them, which may be the reason it is considered fleshy.{{refsrc|mondata.h|240|version=SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2}}

==Strategy==
At a weight of 2 [[aum]], cheese has a [[nutrition/weight]] ratio second only to the [[lembas wafer]], and non-vegan characters may consider it worth hanging on to. Cheese may also have some corner uses in taming rats, e.g. to avoid a potential death as a [[pacifist]].

==Origin==
{{wikipedia}}
Cheese is a dairy product produced in a range of flavors, textures, and forms by acidifying milk and adding particular enzymes in order to separate the milk into solid curds and liquid whey, before pressing them into finished cheese. Some cheeses have aromatic molds on the rind, the outer layer, or throughout the product. Over a thousand types exist, with their styles, textures and flavors depending on the origin of the milk (including the animal's diet), whether they have been pasteurised, the butterfat content, the bacteria and mold, the processing, and how long they have been aged.

Cheese in the pre-modern age was generally made using [[wikipedia:Rennet|rennet]], a set of enzymes produced in the stomachs of calves and other ruminant mammals - the rennet is what separates milk into solid curds and liquid whey. In modern times, most cheese is now made using chymosin from bacterial sources, with less than 5% of cheese in the US made using rennet - this may be the basis for the vegetarian status of cheese in SLASH'EM and other variants.

Cheese is valued for its portability, long shelf life, and high content of fat, protein, calcium, and phosphorus - while it has a longer shelf life than milk, how long a cheese will keep depends on the type: Hard cheeses, such as Parmesan, last longer than soft cheeses, such as Brie or goat's milk cheese. Vacuum packaging of block-shaped cheeses and gas-flushing of plastic bags with mixtures of carbon dioxide and nitrogen are used for storage and mass distribution of cheeses in the 21st century.
